sentences.english: It's carrion! Who killed that man?
sentences.chinese: 不过是一具腐烂的尸体罢了，谁杀了这个人？

sentences.english: Typical goods moved are high demand, high value, perishable .
sentences.chinese: 典型的货物搬到高要求，高价值，易腐烂变质。

sentences.english: His type of wood is prone to rot if not pressure-treated.
sentences.chinese: 他的型木材易腐烂，如果不压治疗。

sentences.english: The rottonextent can reflect the chilling injury of fruit.
sentences.chinese: 因此果实腐烂情况能反映果实冷害的程度。

sentences.english: These bulk items can’t be tidily digested by the plant and so tend to putrefy.
sentences.chinese: 这些大块物质因不能完全被植物消化而腐烂。

sentences.english: Physiological diseases and microbial infection make Chinese chestnut putrid.
sentences.chinese: 板栗腐烂由生理病变和微生物侵染所致。

sentences.english: Fish begin to stink at the head.
The body will be dug up again some time later when it has fully decayed.
sentences.chinese: 不久，等身体全都腐烂后，会再次被挖出。

sentences.english: But its origins, and its effects on Japan, were ultimately rotten.
sentences.chinese: 但是其源头，以及对于日本的影响则最终腐烂。

sentences.english: The putrid odor of rotting meat flooded the corridors.
sentences.chinese: 腐烂的肉类腐烂的气味充斥走廊。

sentences.english: The putrid odor of rotting meat flooded the corridors.
sentences.chinese: 腐烂的肉类腐烂的气味充斥走廊。

sentences.english: Lots of pilots plot to dot the rotten rogrinding bot.
sentences.chinese: 多量领航员规划给腐烂的机器人打点。

sentences.english: This was a part of that ship easily separated from the vessel and turned into the rot.
sentences.chinese: 船上这部分很容易就移除并腐烂。

sentences.english: I don’t want them to rot in no-man’s land.
sentences.chinese: 我不想让他们在荒郊野外腐烂。

sentences.english: I'm afraid we can't accept perishable goods.
sentences.chinese: 我们这里恐怕不能受理易腐烂的物品。

definition: to degenerate/to deteriorate/(of food) to go bad/to go off/(geology) metamorphism
